evaluation_table.original_sap_text: To demonstrate CT-P16 is similar to EU-Approved Avastin in terms of efficacy as determined by objective response rate (ORR) during the Induction Study Period
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: To demonstrate CT-P16 is similar to EU-Approved Avastin in terms of efficacy as determined by objective response rate (ORR) up to Cycle 6 during the Induction Study Period
evaluation_table.protocol_text: To demonstrate CT-P16 is similar to EU-Approved Avastin in terms of efficacy as determined by objective response rate (ORR) up to Cycle 6 during the Induction Study Period
evaluation_table.reasoning: Chain-of-thought: 1) Original SAP omits 'up to Cycle 6'. 2) Generated SAP includes 'up to Cycle 6'. 3) Protocol includes 'up to Cycle 6'. 4) Generated SAP matches Protocol exactly.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: To evaluate additional efficacy profiles including ORR during the Whole Study Period, response duration, time to progression (TTP), progression-free survival (PFS), and overall survival (OS)
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: To evaluate additional efficacy profiles including ORR during the Whole Study Period, response duration, time to progression (TTP), progression-free survival (PFS), and overall survival (OS)
evaluation_table.protocol_text: To evaluate additional efficacy profiles including ORR during the Whole Study Period, response duration, time to progression (TTP), progression-free survival (PFS), and overall survival (OS)
evaluation_table.reasoning: Chain-of-thought: 1) Texts match exactly across all documents.

evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: To evaluate the pharmacokinetics (PK) of trough serum concentration (Ctrough)
evaluation_table.protocol_text: To evaluate the pharmacokinetics (PK) of trough serum concentration (Ctrough)

evaluation_table.protocol_text: To evaluate safety profile including immunogenicity

evaluation_table.reasoning: Chain-of-thought: 1) Generated SAP matches Protocol format/text.

evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: [GAP: No exploratory objectives defined in protocol]
evaluation_table.reasoning: Chain-of-thought: 1) Protocol does not define exploratory objectives. 2) Generated SAP correctly identifies this gap.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: Missing values in ORR will be considered as 'Non-responder' to analyze primary efficacy endpoint.
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: Estimand Specification: Population: ITT/PP... Variable: Objective Response... ICE: Premature discontinuation... non-responders (Composite strategy)...
evaluation_table.reasoning: Chain-of-thought: 1) Original SAP does not have a formal Estimand section but defines non-responder imputation. 2) Generated SAP formalizes this into an ICH E9(R1) estimand structure. 3) The content (non-responder strategy) aligns with Original SAP logic. 4) This is an acceptable enhancement.

missing_information.original_sap_text: The PK population – Maintenance Period Subset will consist of all patients in PK population who received at least 1 dose (full) of either of the study drugs and have at least one post treatment PK result during the Maintenance Study Period.
missing_information.note: Generated SAP defines ITT, PP, PK, Safety but omits the specific Maintenance PK subset defined in Original SAP.
missing_information.reasoning: Chain-of-thought: 1) Original SAP defines a specific subset for maintenance PK. 2) Protocol Section 7.4 only lists ITT, PP, PK, Safety. 3) Generated SAP matches Protocol. 4) This is not a failure, but a difference worth noting.

extra_information_flagged.generated_sap_text: Estimand Specification: Population: ITT/PP... Variable: Objective Response... ICE...
extra_information_flagged.detail: Formalizes the analysis logic into an estimand framework not explicitly present in Original SAP.
extra_information_flagged.reasoning: Chain-of-thought: 1) Original SAP uses non-responder imputation but doesn't use 'Estimand' terminology. 2) Generated SAP adds this structure. 3) It does not contradict the analysis method.

reasoning: Step-by-step chain-of-thought reasoning trace: 1) I compared the Generated SAP against the Protocol and Original SAP. 2) The Generated SAP matches the Protocol text almost exactly for Objectives and Endpoints, often correcting minor phrasing differences found in the Original SAP (e.g., including 'up to Cycle 6' in the primary objective). 3) The Generated SAP correctly identifies that there are no exploratory objectives. 4) The Generated SAP adds an Estimand section which formalizes the non-responder imputation logic found in the Original SAP; this is a positive addition aligning with modern standards. 5) The Generated SAP omits a specific 'PK Maintenance Subset' population found in the Original SAP, but since this population is not in the Protocol, the Generated SAP is technically correct per the instructions to prioritize the Protocol. 6) Overall, the document is highly accurate.
summary: The Generated SAP is excellent. It faithfully reproduces the Protocol's objectives and endpoints, correctly identifies the absence of exploratory endpoints, and structures the primary analysis logic into a formal Estimand framework consistent with the Original SAP's intent.
